messages: ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (09:57): http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk/7853400.stm - "In 2007, the DVLA (Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agency) raised ¬£83m by auctioning off previously unissued numbers." - I wish I could work out how to make a fortune by selling arbitrary numbers that have zero intrinsic value
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (09:57): HTML5 needs to add some centrally-adminstered artificially scarce resources; the domain name people have got the right idea
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:58): what do you think i'm refusing to allow extensibility of the element names?

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (09:59): 0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17: Depends what you're measuring - it's a fairly accurate means of measuring how many pages listed on dmoz.org use a <canvas> element in their markup :-)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (09:59): and it's not too hopelessly inaccurate to extrapolate that to a larger portion of the web
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (10:00): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: yes, as long as you don't conflate use of <canvas> with use of canvas
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (10:02): also I suspect use of canvas is bigger off the traditional web
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (10:02): look at widgets/gadgets
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (10:05): 0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17: I think it's hard for me to find scripted uses of <canvas> since I haven't downloaded any scripts
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (10:06): though I don't suppose there's any real reason why I couldn't add code to download scripts
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (10:06): other than laziness

62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (10:08): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: so, with the new redaction of the 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fcpcache spec, all HTML documents in an 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fcplication need to have a manifest attribute, not just the main one. why is this helpful?
62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (10:10): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: I thought of the manifest attribute as something that was only needed once, at the root level

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:10): that's always how it's been, no? as far as i recall it's always has been my intent. why would you serve a page differently based purely on whether you'd loaded another page first?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:10): i don't understand what you mean

62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (10:11): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: I'm fairly sure that previously, a document that was loaded from cache and that didn't have a manifest attribute was associated to the cache, and not marked as foreign
62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (10:11): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: and that seemed like reasonable behavior to me
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:12): hm
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (10:12): Also: XHTML is dying - I saw 39 pages sent as 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fcplication/xhtml+xml a year ago, and only 35 yesterday
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (10:12): (Don't bother telling me about standard deviations or any of that nonsense - it's definitely dying!)

62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (10:12): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: "serve a page differently based purely on whether you'd loaded another page first" - sure, it's a part of a locally installed offline 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fcplication
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:13): so once a page has had a manifest, even if you remove the manifest="" attribute, it'll keep being served from that manifest?

62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (10:14): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: yes - I think I asked you about this a couple of weeks ago, and you answered that the manifest must become 404, and that's the only way
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:14): ok well fair enough :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:17): 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc: can you drop me a mail? i'm in the middle of a big reorg and i'm going to go to bed before i finish it.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:17): thanks
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:22): nn
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:45): http://andrewdupont.net/2009/01/27/thought-html5-and-the-alt-attribute/
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:46): on twitter someone asked about getElementsByAttribute()
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:46): seems more like a Web DOM addition
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:46): zcorpan ^^
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:49): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: sigh. still rampant point missing on the alt topic

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:50): I was mostly amused by that post "and the number of people on earth who care about valid HTML ‚Äî but don‚Äôt care even a little about accessibility ‚Äî could fit into my pants"
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:52): where's the spec for CSS :not()?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:53): http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-selectors/ 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fcparently
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:58): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, we have querySelectorAll("[attribute]");
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:59): not live
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:59): but yeah
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:59): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: why would anyone actually *want* live?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:59): liveness is a design bug, IMO
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:01): hmm. I guess that looks weird if taken out of context
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:04): hmm, svg > video, svg :not(foreignObject) > video
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:04): and remove the > from the second selector
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:04): I think that would work fine

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:05): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: does that mean that none of the elements between svg and video is foreignObject or that there is at least one element there that isn't foreignObject?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:06): you're right, it wouldn't work
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:07): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, the only way to make it work effectively is to do this:
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:07): svg>:not(foreignObject)>a
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:07): svg>:not(foreignObject)>:not(foreignObject)>a
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:07): svg>:not(foreignObject)>:not(foreignObject)>:not(foreignObject)>a
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:07): indeed :/
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:07): given that this use case is extremely minor anyway, it does not seem worth the effort
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:08): given that no use cases have been presented yet, indeed
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:14): http://twitter.com/grorg/status/1131211278 :)
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:17): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, what are you coming to Oslo for and how long are you staying?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:17): meeting up with chaals and marcos, mostly
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:17): staying until Feb 15
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:19): cool. You're arriving just in time for the Global Village thing that Opera's doing for Friday beer this week
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:20): yeah, I heard that was on but wasn't sure whether I would want to represent the Dutch there :)
